messages.title: Dear The Residents
messages.content: In 2017, I was proud to be re-elected for a third term as a Labour MP. I was grateful and humbled by the support residents had shown, and for their clear rejection of the Conservative Brexit agenda.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour voters rightly abandoned Jeremy Corbyn in their droves.

issues.brexitEurope: clear rejection of the Conservative Brexit agenda
issues.governance: Labour Party I joined has let down millions of its own supporters, by aiding and abetting the Conservatives on Brexit. The party has become one that tolerates anti-Jewish racism, and a culture of bullying.

leaflet.personalStatement: I just couldn't stay with Labour. Jeremy Corbyn's failure to rid the Labour Party of anti-semitism and his dereliction of duty on Brexit, the biggest national crisis in a generation, compelled me to leave the Labour Party.

quotes.text: If Remainers come together, we can combat the hatred and division at the extremes of the Conservative and Labour parties. We can build a brighter future.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Chuka Umunna joined the Liberal Democrats in June and urges voters to vote Liberal Democrat to have an ambitious plan for the future of the country.
